channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: MacBook 12,9 pouces : tout savoir sur le prochain Mac d’entrée de gamme
item.description: Apple s'apprêterait à ressusciter le MacBook "tout court" avec une recette surprenante : une puce d'iPhone A18 Pro et un prix sous les 800 euros.

item.title: The Shokz OpenFit Air earbuds are matching their all-time low price
item.description: If you like to take your workouts outside, open-ear earbuds are helpful for staying aware of surroundings, but that extra peace of mind often comes at the expense of bass. The Shokz OpenFit Air Earbuds actually try to address that problem, though, and they’re currently $79.95 ($40 off) at Amazon, Target, and directly from Shokz […]

item.title: Hate WhatsApp on Android? Try my picks for 5 great alternatives
item.description: Whether your priority is privacy, customization, or other features, there'll be a WhatsApp alternative that suits you.

item.title: La fiche technique complète des Galaxy S26 a fuité
item.description: Au point où on en est, Samsung n'a plus besoin de s'embêter à organiser un événement Unpacked : un simple communiqué de presse suffira ! Car grâce aux innombrables fuites, on sait désormais à peu près tout de la gamme Galaxy S26, que le constructeur doit présenter le 25 février. Dernier exemple en date, voici la fiche technique complète.

item.title: Microsoft is keeping Secure Boot alive with Windows updates
item.description: Microsoft is automatically replacing boot-level security certificates on Windows devices before they start expiring later this year. The new Secure Boot certificates will be rolled out as part of the regular Windows platform updates, according to Microsoft's announcement blog, marking a "generational refresh" of the security standard. Secure Boot was introduced in 2011 to protect […]...

item.title: Microsoft will start refreshing Secure Boot certificates in March for Windows 11 and Windows 10 ESU users
item.description: Get ye to Windows Update, because there's a good chance you've got new Secure Boot certificates to install. Microsoft just announced that it will be refreshing those certificates, which were originally introduced when Secure Boot debuted in 2011, as a security precaution. Secure Boot was a way for Microsoft to protect systems from running unsigned and potentially malicious code before Windows launched. It went on to be an installation requirement for Windows 11, as well as anti-cheat software used in Valorant, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6/7 and Battlefield 6. Without the new Secure Boot certific...

item.title: Why the ‘Spider-Noir’ Show Stars Ben Reilly and Not Peter Parker
item.description: Ben Reilly is a complicated character, and making him the lead of 'Spider-Noir' only adds to that—but there's a reason for it.

item.title: Ayaneo's massive Next 2 handheld has a similarly massive price tag
item.description: There appears to be no limit to how chonky and eye-wateringly expensive PC gaming handhelds can get, with the latest behemoth being the Ayaneo Next 2. First announced back in November, the latest Windows handheld in Ayaneo’s Next lineup is now up for pre-order, with a spec sheet that makes some of its rivals look modest. If you missed the announcement at the end of last year, the Next 2 is packing a 9-inch OLED display with a 2,400 x 1,504 resolution and a maximum refresh rate of 165Hz (adjustable down to 60Hz). The Next 2 is powered by an AMD Ryzen AI Max+ 395 chip and has a massive 115Mh bat...

item.title: iPhone 17 Pro : le nouveau coloris qui a permis à Apple de battre des records en Chine
item.description: En misant sur un coloris "Orange Étoilé" aux faux airs de luxe, Apple a vu ses ventes exploser de 38 % en un trimestre.

item.title: Samsung 990 Evo Plus : ce SSD interne 1 To pour PS5 ou PC est en promo en pleine flambée des prix
item.description: Ce n'est plus une surprise : les SSD internes sont bien plus onéreux qu'auparavant. Alors quand des offres intéressantes se présentent, mieux vaut en profiter sans trop tarder. Par exemple, le Samsung 990 Evo Plus de 1 To est proposé à 127,99 euros au lieu de 170 euros sur Amazon.

item.title: I've been covering gaming laptops for years — these are the 9 I'd buy this week
item.description: I've looked through hundreds of discounted gaming laptops today — these 9 are the obvious picks if you're looking to buy.

item.title: US judicial body removes climate research paper after complaints from Republicans
item.description: A US judicial body has revised an internal document to remove climate research. The Reference Manual on Scientific Evidence is a document used by judges when they have to oversee cases involving complex scientific matters. The climate science chapter has now been deleted, so they'll be on their own with climate-related cases. This move came after a group of Republican state attorneys wrote a letter to complain about the chapter on climate change. The language in the document, which was authored by researchers from Columbia University, suggests that climate change is driven by the actions of hu...

item.title: Sam Altman and Jony Ive’s AI Gadget Just Hit Another Eyebrow-Raising Roadblock
item.description: Problems seem to be piling up for the duo's AI gadgets.

item.title: Google can now help you find and remove your ID from search results
item.description: Google is expanding its tools for removing your sensitive information and nonconsensual images from its search results. The company announced on Tuesday that you can now use its "results about you" tool to remove your driver's license, passport, and Social Security number from search, in addition to your phone number and address. Once you add […]

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI Can’t Stop Bleeding Cofounders

item.title: Psy-ops built car culture
item.description: To change our built environment, we’ve got to understand the forces that fuel our choices. I don’t care if you own a car, SUV, minivan, pickup truck, private jet, or one of each. This essay isn’t a judgment on consumerism. It’s about how the forces shaping our automotive obsession ripple into land use policy, infrastructure funding, government subsidies, and every facet of urbanism....

item.title: Razer’s resurrected 25-year-old gaming mouse will cost you $1,337
item.description: Nostalgia's getting expensive. When Razer announced last December it would be relaunching the world's first gaming mouse with a few modern upgrades, it didn't reveal how much the Razer Boomslang 20th Anniversary Edition would cost or when it would be released. The company will officially open preorders for the mouse on February 10th at 8AM […]

item.title: Telegram is reportedly being slowed down and restricted in Russia
item.description: Telegram users in Russia may begin noticing service disruptions on Tuesday after Russia's communications regulator, Roskomnadzor, reportedly moved to slow down and restrict access to the app, as reported by Russian news outlet RBC. Roskomnadzor said in a statement to RBC, translated using machine translation, that it "will continue to introduce successive restrictions" on Telegram, […]...

item.title: ‘It’s absurd’: YouTube TV subscribers slam its new sports subscription plan, despite its tempting price tag
item.description: New YouTube TV subscription tiers are on the way, but ESPN Unlimited is missing from the pack, and sports fans aren't happy.

item.description: If you're shopping for a new mid-sized OLED TV and you have a tight budget, then it's easy to recommend this excellent LG B5 while it's massively reduced in the Presidents' Day sales at Best Buy.

item.description: As one lawyer labels social media platforms “digital casinos” that create dopamine addiction in children, Meta and YouTube dispute the claim.

item.title: Directive 8020 brings sci-fi survival horror to PS5, Xbox Series X/S and PC on May 12
item.description: Supermassive Games has announced a new release date for the next entry in the Dark Pictures Anthology series. Directive 8020 is coming to PS5, Xbox Series X/S and Steam on May 12. The studio behind Until Dawn and The Quarry revealed the news with the help of a fresh trailer for the sci-fi survival horror game.The story focuses on the crew of a spaceship that has crash landed onto another world. The survivors have to contend with an alien lifeform that's hunting them and can mimic its prey (no prizes for guessing that Supermassive took inspiration from The Thing here). If these astronauts want ...

item.title: Why corporate America is hedging as immigration agents show up at its doors
item.description: Companies tend to hedge on issues that are contested and polarizing. When U.S. Border Patrol agents entered a Target store in Richfield, Minnesota, in early January, detaining two employees, it marked a new chapter in the relationship between corporate America and the federal government.

item.title: Former Tesla product manager wants to make luxury goods impossible to fake, starting with a chip
item.description: The fake goods crisis cuts two ways. Luxury brands lose more than $30 billion a year to counterfeits, while buyers in the booming $210 billion second-hand market have no reliable way to verify that what they’re purchasing is genuine. Veritas wants to solve both problems with a solution that combines custom hardware and software. The […]

item.title: Meta, TikTok and Snap are participating in an online safety ratings system
item.description: Numerous major social platforms including Meta, YouTube, TikTok and Snap say they will submit to a new external grading process that scores social platforms on how well they protect adolescent mental health. The program comes from the Mental Health Coalition’s Safe Online Standards (SOS) initiative, which comprises about two dozen standards covering areas like platform policy, functionality, governance and transparency, content oversight and more. The SOS initiative is led by Dr. Dan Reidenberg, Managing Director of the National Council for Suicide Prevention. In announcing these companies' pa...

item.title: At the Meta and YouTube trial, plaintiff’s lawyer says social media is ‘addicting the brains of children’
item.description: On day one of the trial, Meta attorney Paul Schmidt spoke of the disagreement within the scientific community over social media addiction. Comparing social media platforms to casinos and addictive drugs, lawyer Mark Lanier delivered opening statements Monday in a landmark trial in Los Angeles that seeks to hold Instagram owner Meta and Google’s YouTube responsible for harms to children who use their products.Instagram’s parent company Meta and Google’s YouTube face claims that their platforms addict children through deliberate design choices that keep kids glued to their screens. TikTok and Sn...

item.title: Spotify executives just revealed why you couldn’t stop talking about Wrapped: ‘We turned up the dial’
item.description: In a blockbuster earnings report, the Swedish streamer said more than 300 million users engaged with the viral feature after it listened to user feedback. Shares in Spotify Technology SA (NYSE: SPOT), the world’s largest music streamer, are surging this morning.

item.title: Rachat de Warner : le coup de théâtre de Paramount qui pourrait tout faire basculer face à Netflix
item.description: Alors que Warner a déjà donné son accord pour un rachat par Netflix, Paramount a avancé plusieurs arguments visant à séduire les actionnaires et les inciter à lui revendre ses parts.

item.title: Singapore says China-backed hackers targeted its four largest phone companies
item.description: The Singaporean government said the China-backed hackers gained "limited access to critical systems" run by the country's top four telecommunication giants, but said they did not disrupt services or steal customers' data.

item.description: ICE plans to lease offices throughout the US as part of a secret, monthslong expansion campaign. WIRED is publishing dozens of these locations.

item.title: Mozilla’s new AI strategy marks a return to its ‘rebel alliance’ roots
item.description: New browser controls that let users disable AI features point to a broader push against default-on artificial intelligence. As Big Tech races to weave AI into nearly every product, Mozilla is betting some users want the opposite: the ability to turn it off.

item.title: Microsoft wants to rewire data centers to save space
item.description: Microsoft wants to design more efficient data centers using materials that allow electricity to flow with zero resistance. If these new materials, called high-temperature superconductors, can make it to market, Microsoft thinks it could be a game changer for how data centers and the energy infrastructure they connect to are built. Tech companies are facing […]...

item.title: Le premier appareil d’OpenAI perd son nom et glisse vers 2027
item.description: Le futur appareil IA concocté par OpenAI et Jony Ive ne s'appellera pas « io ». Et une présentation, voire un lancement, dans le courant du second semestre a pris du plomb dans l'aile, selon des documents judiciaires.

In 2022, Jennette McCurdy released her memoir I’m Glad My Mom Died, a brutally honest portrait of her life as a former child star, her battle with eating disorders, and, as the title would suggest, her rather complicated relationship with her mother....

item.title: Google's new tool helps you remove non-consensual explicit images from Search
item.description: The internet is ripe with horrible violations of people's privacy, including non-consensual explicit images. A new tool from Google won't do much in the way of prevention, but can help you remove this media from Search. Now, you can choose an image and quickly request its deletion. Just click on the three dots that appear on the image. From there, choose "remove result" and then "It shows a sexual image of me." Other choices include the picture shows a person under 18 and that it has your personal information. If you choose the initial option then you will also be asked whether it contains a ...

item.title: Amazon retire plus de 1 000 € sur ce TV LG OLED 120 Hz géant de 77 pouces, c’est le super deal du jour
item.description: Ne vous fiez pas à son positionnement entrée de gamme : le LG OLED77B5 est un TV géant polyvalent taillé pour le gaming (4K 120 Hz, HDMI 2.1, VRR) et le home cinéma. Il voit son prix chuter à seulement 1 529 euros contre 2 799 euros au lancement.

item.title: How sports leagues are vying for Gen Z and Gen Alpha’s attention to build the next generation of fans
item.description: Mark Beal, a communication professor at Rutgers, says media consumption for Gen Z and Gen Alpha is ‘uprecedented’. Trevor McOmber and his 14-year-old son, Tye, share a love for the Chicago Blackhawks. When Trevor was his son’s age, he watched the Blackhawks on TV, caught highlights on ESPN and read about the team in the newspaper.It’s a much different experience for Tye.“I go to YouTube with Snapchat, or Google something if I just have an idea that I want to know,” Tye McOmber said while sitting next to his father at a recent Blackhawks game.Tye McOmber is on the border of Generation Z, born r...

item.title: Sony met fin à ses enregistreurs Blu-ray
item.description: Le géant japonais Sony a officialisé en février 2026 l'arrêt de l'expédition de l'ensemble de ses enregistreurs Blu-ray. Cette décision, qui intervient sans qu'aucune nouvelle génération ne soit prévue, montre le recul continu du support optique grand public face à la domination du streaming.

item.title: Proton VPN deal: Get up to 70 percent off two-year plans
item.description: Proton VPN is running a solid deal right now, dropping its two-year Proton VPN Plus plan to $2.99 per month. That works out to $72 billed upfront for the first 24 months, which represents a 70 percent discount compared to its regular pricing. We’ve rated Proton VPN highly thanks to its strong privacy credentials, transparent nonprofit backing and consistently fast performance. It’s one of the services we recommend in our guide to the best VPNs, and this deal also shows up alongside other standout offers in our ongoing roundup of the best VPN deals. It’s a good option if you’re looking to lock ...

item.title: Elevation Lab's 10-year extended battery case for AirTag is back on sale for $16
item.description: If you're an iPhone user who likes to keep tabs on where your stuff is, you can't go far wrong with an AirTag. The second-gen model that Apple just released outpaces the original in every way (aside from the galling lack of a keyring hole, that is). While it's easy enough to replace the battery in both versions of the AirTag, you might not want to have to worry about the device's battery life for a very long time. Enter Elevation Lab's extended battery case for the AirTag, which is currently on sale at Amazon for $16. The case usually sells for $23, so that's a 30 percent discount. It's not th...
